body:
As a lurker on reddit, I used to just browse by hot or whatever my feed gave me. On Ruqqus Im having a blast sorting by new and discovering posts as they come up.

 Its surprising how a difference in culture makes this an enjoyable experience, im contributing to threads i would never see on reddit. if you havent tried it yet, i would really reccomend it. 
Ive posted more in the last day on Ruqqus, than the last month on Reddit.

title: Browsing by new is actually.... fun?

body: That's what happens when you leave a nest of bots, creeps and lunatics and come to a fresh platform where they haven't taken over yet. Here's hoping they never will.

body: It's how all content gets to the top, if you sort by new and comment and interact with those new posts, you are directly involved in helping them become "hot" and "front page" material. Sorting by new makes you a rep maker.

body:
The comment system is terrible for hundreds and especially thousands of comments. 
Also I'm sure that bots are involved. Imagine a machine learning bot scanning all comments and upvoting the ones that the operator wants them to upvote to push a certain narrative. Now imagine hundreds or thousands of such bots operating on reddit.
body_html: The comment system is terrible for hundreds and especially thousands of comments. Also I'm sure that bots are involved. Imagine a machine learning bot scanning all comments and upvoting the ones that the operator wants them to upvote to push a certain narrative. Now imagine hundreds or thousands of such bots operating on reddit.

Its surprising how a difference in culture makes this an enjoyable experience, im contributing to threads i would never see on reddit. if you havent tried it yet, i would really reccomend it. Ive posted more in the last day on Ruqqus, than the last month on Reddit.

parent.body:
The comment system is terrible for hundreds and especially thousands of comments. 
Also I'm sure that bots are involved. Imagine a machine learning bot scanning all comments and upvoting the ones that the operator wants them to upvote to push a certain narrative. Now imagine hundreds or thousands of such bots operating on reddit.

body:
My [albert](https://albertlauncher.github.io/) brings up `https://ruqqus.com/?sort=new` by default as well.

This whole experience is bringing back oceans of fun back to the web, old fucks like myself used to get lost in on the regular back when people still called the web the _"information superhighway"._

Keep on fighting the good fight everyone!

Its surprising how a difference in culture makes this an enjoyable experience, im contributing to threads i would never see on reddit. if you havent tried it yet, i would really reccomend it. Ive posted more in the last day on Ruqqus, than the last month on Reddit.

body: This is actually a criticism I had about the voting system. It seems like in larger threads especially there was little to no interaction between users. Only responses to the actual post itself. I think this is because your comments inevitably end up buried, and no one else even get the opportunity to see them, under all the super upvoted ones

body: It's the comment lottery. Those making comments early enough have a chance at having the most upvoted comment, which then gets the majority of discussion, and the top comment is usually some low effort joke so no little actual discussion takes place. By the time the post appears on r/all it's already too late to have any discussion. It's like the system is designed to stifle meaningful discussion.
body_html: It's the comment lottery. Those making comments early enough have a chance at having the most upvoted comment, which then gets the majority of discussion, and the top comment is usually some low effort joke so no little actual discussion takes place. By the time the post appears on r/all it's already too late to have any discussion. It's like the system is designed to stifle meaningful discussion.

parent.body: That's what happens when you leave a nest of bots, creeps and lunatics and come to a fresh platform where they haven't taken over yet. Here's hoping they never will.
parent.body_html: That's what happens when you leave a nest of bots, creeps and lunatics and come to a fresh platform where they haven't taken over yet. Here's hoping they never will.

post.body:
As a lurker on reddit, I used to just browse by hot or whatever my feed gave me. On Ruqqus Im having a blast sorting by new and discovering posts as they come up.

 Its surprising how a difference in culture makes this an enjoyable experience, im contributing to threads i would never see on reddit. if you havent tried it yet, i would really reccomend it. 
Ive posted more in the last day on Ruqqus, than the last month on Reddit.

post.title: Browsing by new is actually.... fun?

body:
Exactly. You may be interested in a [post](https://ruqqus.com/post/qp1/methods-for-giving-controversial-content-more) I made about the subject recently.... I didn't do a great job elaborating on the concept. Perhaps I should make another post going into more detail. 

In general though, I think the voting system needs to either be completely overhauled to promote discussion, while also being inclusive of controversial opinions, or it needs to be replaced by something that does.

Exactly. You may be interested in a post I made about the subject recently.... I didn't do a great job elaborating on the concept. Perhaps I should make another post going into more detail.

parent.body: It's the comment lottery. Those making comments early enough have a chance at having the most upvoted comment, which then gets the majority of discussion, and the top comment is usually some low effort joke so no little actual discussion takes place. By the time the post appears on r/all it's already too late to have any discussion. It's like the system is designed to stifle meaningful discussion.
